entry.title: â€˜Big Shortâ€™ Investor Michael Burry Says He Was Wrong to Advise Selling; Congratulates â€˜BTFD Generationâ€™
entry.summary:
Famed â€œBig Shortâ€ investor Michael Burry tweeted Thursday, telling his 1.4 million followers, â€œI was wrong to say sell.â€ The tweet follows Burryâ€™s warning for months that the U.S. was headed for an â€œextended multi-year recessionâ€ and his decision to dump all of his stocks but one in August 2022.
Burry: â€˜I Was Wrong to Say Sellâ€™
Michael Burry, known as â€œCassandra B.C.â€ on Twitter, is well-known for his predictions. He famously predicted and profited from the subprime mortgage crisis of 2007-2008. Burryâ€™s unconventional investment strategies led to fame when Michael Lewis chronicled Burryâ€™s forecasting of the 2008 financial crisis in his book and movie, â€œThe Big Short.â€ In more recent times, Burry has been bearish again, predicting in December that the U.S. economy would falter into an â€œâ€¦

Value Locked in Defi Holds the Line at $50B, After Temporarily Shedding $8B in Mid-March
entry.summary:
The total value locked (TVL) in decentralized finance (defi) during the first week of April is about $50 billion, roughly the same as on March 1. The value locked dropped to $42 billion on March 12 but has since rebounded as protocols such as Lido Finance, Aave, and Justlend recorded double-digit monthly gains.
After the March 12 Dip, the Value Locked in Decentralized Finance Rebounds to $50B
According to statistics, the value locked in defi on April 2, 2023, is $50.22 billion, up 0.91% in the past 24 hours. The protocol Lido Finance commands a TVL of around $10.94 billion as of Sunday. Lido dominates the $50 billion TVL with 21.77%, and the value locked in the protocol saw a 19.75% rise in March.
Makerdaoâ€™s TVL is below Lidoâ€™s at $7.7 billion as it rose 9.66% last month. Aaveâ€™s TVL â€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin Up For Grabs On The Moon: SpaceX, LunarCrush To Send Crypto To The Lunar Surface
entry.summary:
A prominent cryptocurrency company, LunarCrush, has stated that in the fall of this year, it will send a private key to a bitcoin wallet holding 62 BTCs to the moon via a SpaceX rocket.
According to Joe Vezzani, CEO of LunarCrush, the purpose of this stunt is to â€œinspire people to establish networks that will unlock a new era of exploration.â€
A quote from his press statement reads:
â€œItâ€™s like Willy Wonkaâ€™s â€˜golden ticketâ€™ for the Web3 era, and we couldnâ€™t be more excited to see how it all unfolds.â€
$1.7 Million Bitcoin Bounty On The Moon
The company guarantees the safety of the wallet, which includes around $1.7 million in BTC at the current price of the coin, because not even its employees will know the code.
The stakes can be raised, though, because the wallet is public and â€¦

entry.title: Dogecoin: Elon Musk Seeks To Dismiss $258 Billion Lawsuit
entry.summary:
Elon Musk, the self-acclaimed â€œDogefather,â€ has asked a US Judge to dismiss a $258 billion lawsuit filed against him in 2022. The lawsuit accuses Musk of manipulating the price of Dogecoin in a Ponzi-like manner leading investors to lose money on their investments.Â
Musk denies this and has filed for the court to dismiss the complaint. His lawyers, in the filing, noted that the lawsuit is a â€˜â€™fanciful work of fictionâ€™â€™ over his innocent and often silly tweets about Dogecoin.Â They further stated that the plaintiff never explained how Musk intended to defraud anyone with his tweets and that statements like â€˜â€™no highs, no lows, only Dogeâ€™â€™ were insufficient to support fraud claims.Â
Related Reading: Can Dogecoin Reach Its Previous ATH? Letâ€™s Take A Look At The Facts
Muskâ€™s lawyers addedâ€¦

entry.title: Justin Sun In Talks To Sell Huobi Stake: Report
entry.summary:
The founder of Tron network and popular crypto figure Justin Sun is reportedly engaging in talks about selling a stake in the crypto exchange Huobi Global. According to a reportÂ by Bloomberg, this development was revealed by a person that is close to the matter.
Bloomberg reports that Sun has been meeting with potential investors trying to gauge their interest in Huobi. However, it remains unknown how large of a stake is to be sold or the valuation at which such a stake will be sold.
A Bloomberg insider disclosed that the deal is still in its â€œearly stagesâ€, and it cannot be said if any of these potential investors will proceed with the acquisition.Â
Based in Singapore, Huobi Global is one of the biggest digital assets exchanges in Asia, offering support for over 400 cryptocurrenciesâ€¦

entry.title: German Stock Exchange Boerse Stuttgart to Provide Crypto Custody Through Licensed Subsidiary
entry.summary:
Blocknox, a subsidiary of one of Europeâ€™s largest stock exchanges, Boerse Stuttgart, has been licensed to operate as a crypto custodian in Germany. The authorization will allow the company to offer custody services for digital assets to institutional investors across the Old Continent.
Boerse Stuttgart Subsidiary Blocknox to Offer Crypto Custody Services Under Bafin License
Germanyâ€™s second-largest stock exchange and one of the largest in Europe, Boerse Stuttgart, will be able to provide European banks, brokers, asset managers, and family offices with both trading and custody solutions for their crypto asset offerings.
Its subsidiary, Blocknox, which is part of the Boerse Stuttgart Digital division, has received the final license for its operations as a crypto custodian from the Bundâ€¦

entry.title: Crypto ATM Numbers Drop by 13.91% Since December 2022, Over 3,600 Went Offline in March
entry.summary:
According to data from the cryptocurrency automated teller machine (ATM) aggregation website Coin ATM Radar, over 3,600 crypto ATMs went offline in March. Since the end of 2022, the number of crypto ATMs has declined by 13.91% in the last three months.
Crypto ATM Numbers Decline in 2023
According to data from Coin ATM Radar, the number of crypto ATMs worldwide has decreased by 13.91% since December 2022. At that time, 39,179 crypto ATMs were installed globally.
In January, 1,587 crypto ATMs went offline, marking the second time a large number of machines had gone offline since the loss of 399 crypto ATMs in September 2022. In February 2023, the decline in crypto ATMs was less drastic than in January and fewer than the drawdown in September.
A total of 275 cryptocurrency ATMs wentâ€¦

entry.title: Crypto Exchange Bittrex Shuts Down US Operations Due to Regulatory Uncertainty
entry.summary:
Cryptocurrency exchange Bittrex is shutting down its U.S. operations due to â€œcontinued regulatory uncertaintyâ€ as U.S. regulators increase their enforcement efforts against cryptocurrency trading platforms. Regulatory requirements currently â€œare often unclear and enforced without appropriate discussion or input, resulting in an uneven competitive landscape,â€ Bittrex described.
Bittrex Exiting U.S. Crypto Market
Cryptocurrency exchange Bittrex announced the shutdown of its U.S. operations on Friday. The exchange tweeted:
Due to continued regulatory uncertainty, we have made the difficult decision to wind down our U.S. operations, effective April 30, 2023.
â€œAll funds are safe and can be fully withdrawn immediately,â€ the announcement adds, emphasizing that the closure does not affectâ€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin Profits Deemed Taxable by Denmarkâ€™s Supreme Court
entry.summary:
Profits from the sale of cryptocurrencies like bitcoin are taxable, according to two rulings by the Supreme Court of Denmark. The verdicts in the cases, which involve crypto purchases and payments as well as income received from bitcoin mining, uphold decisions of lower courts.
Denmarkâ€™s High Court Considers Crypto Gains Taxable Under Current Law
Profits made from the sale of bitcoin are taxable in Denmark, the countryâ€™s Supreme Court has decided in two separate rulings announced on Thursday. Both decisions are in lawsuits filed against the Danish Ministry of Taxation and confirm verdicts issued by lower-instance courts.
In one of the cases, the plaintiff acquired a certain amount of digital coins in 2011 â€“ 2015, through purchases and donations from third parties for the development â€¦

entry.summary:
FTXâ€™s European subsidiary, FTX Europe, has launched a new website, ftxeurope.eu, for users to withdraw funds from the now-defunct cryptocurrency platform. Withdrawal requests must be submitted through the new website and will be â€œsubject to customary know-your-customer and anti-money-laundering checks.â€
FTXâ€™s European Arm Opens Withdrawals to Customers
According to a press release published on Friday, another division of FTX will allow withdrawals. FTXâ€™s European subsidiary, FTX EU, has begun the process of returning segregated funds to customers in compliance with Cyprus law. The subsidiary was announced in March 2022. â€œWe will interact with regulators in various European countries to maintain a safe and secure environment for cryptocurrency trading,â€ said Sam Bankman-Fried, then-CEO â€¦

entry.title: US Government Plans to Sell Over 41,000 Bitcoins Confiscated from Silk Road Hacker
entry.summary:
According to a court document filed on March 31, 2023, regarding the sentencing of James Zhong, who stole over 50,000 bitcoin from the Silk Road marketplace, the U.S. government plans to liquidate 41,490 bitcoin â€œover the course of this calendar year.â€
U.S. Government Discloses Strategy for Selling Confiscated Bitcoin
The U.S. government, one of the largest holders of bitcoin, plans to sell 41,490 BTC in 2023, according to a court filing submitted in the case of James Zhongâ€™s sentencing. The government made the historic bitcoin seizure in November 2022 when it confiscated over 50,000 BTC from Zhong. The defendant pleaded guilty â€œto committing wire fraud in September 2012 when he unlawfully obtained over 50,000 bitcoin from the Silk Road dark web internet marketplace.â€

entry.summary: The dress, inspired by Bored Ape Yacht Club NFTs and Tamâ€™s signature East-meets-West design aesthetic, debuted in Decentraland this week.

entry.title: Pussy Riot Protest Art NFT Triggers Russian Criminal Charges
entry.summary: Activist artist Nadya Tolokonnikova was added to a wanted list over a 2021 NFT piece depicting the Virgin Mary.

entry.title: Coin Center Says RESTRICT Act Could Be Used to Ban Bitcoin
entry.summary: Though it primarily targets companies like Tik-Tok, the billâ€™s language is much too broad, according to the crypto advocacy group.

entry.title: At Least $37M Worth of y00ts NFTs Migrate to Polygon From Solana in One Day
entry.summary: Nearly 77% of all y00ts NFTs have switched chains since late Monday, with DeGods still set to leave Solana for Ethereum this Friday.

entry.title: SEC's Gensler Insists Clear Rules for Crypto Market 'Already Exist'
entry.summary: But the regulator says that the digital asset industry is still â€œrife with noncompliance.â€

entry.title: Paxful Vows to Refund Celsius Earn Bankruptcy Victims
entry.summary: â€œWe all need to hold ourselves to a higher standard,â€ declared CEO Ray Youssef.

entry.title: Art Blocks Debuts NFT Marketplace With Enforced Creator Royalties
entry.summary: The generative art NFT platform now has a secondary marketplaceâ€”and is considering how to incentivize royalties-paying collectors.

entry.title: Why Aurory's Head of Production Left Ubisoft for Web3
entry.summary: Aurory executive producer and head of production Jonathan Campeau tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about how the first-generation of Web3 games came out of DeFi and are now evolving.

entry.title: 'We Don't Really Do the Corporate Thing Very Well' Says Jason Brink on Gala Games Approach
entry.summary: With roughly 50 video games in its pipeline, Gala Games is all-in on Web3. Gala's President of Blockchain Jason Brink told Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about the studio's ethos and weighs in on the different approaches to Web3 gaming.

entry.title: gm: Coinbase's Top Lawyer Gets Real on SEC
entry.summary: Paul Grewal is the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase and a former U.S. magistrate judge in Northern California. He gave Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott his candid takes on Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX, the SEC's crackdown on staking, the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, and more alpha on how Coinbase is approaching the current unfriendly US regulatory environment. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isnâ€™t Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet
entry.summary: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.

entry.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved
entry.summary: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'
entry.summary: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decryptâ€™s Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and whyâ€”despite his growing profileâ€”he opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.

entry.title: Midnight Societyâ€™s Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect
entry.summary: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.

entry.title: Big Brands Get Serious About NFTs: Salesforce, VW, Panerai, Absolute Labs at NFT Paris
entry.summary: On this panel from NFT Paris 2023 moderated by Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Web3 leads from some of the largest consumer and tech brands discuss their NFT strategies. Marc Mathieu of Salesforce, Tim Walther of VW Group, Eva Assayag of Panerai, and Samir Addamine of Absolute Labs joined the panel.

entry.title: NFT Entertainment Revolution: Warner Bros, Orange Comet, CyberBrokers and NFT Now at NFT Paris
entry.summary: At NFT Paris 2023, Decryptâ€™s Stephen Graves moderated a discussion about NFTs and the entertainment industry with Warner Brosâ€™ NFT head Josh Hackbarth, CyberBrokers founder Josie Bellini, NFT Now founder Matt Medved and Dave Broome, CEO of Orange Comet, which has produced NFTs for Anthony Hopkins and The Walking Dead.

entry.title: Step Inside the Armory of the NFT Collective 'Knights Who Say Nah'
entry.summary: Knights Who Say Nah co-founder and project lead Nick Richey chats with Decrypt's Jason Nelson inside the group's armory of artifacts, shows off a historic Japanese tanto sword, and discusses why the preservation of historical artifacts is the best use case for NFTs.

entry.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity
entry.summary: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.

entry.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'
entry.summary: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily livesâ€”and his prediction that brands will drive that.

entry.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past
entry.summary: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.

entry.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'
entry.summary: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."

entry.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young
entry.summary: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.

entry.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs
entry.summary: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.

entry.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.

entry.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'
entry.summary: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.

entry.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'
entry.summary: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX Group, which also owns the IEX exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
